gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Table
Class TableJPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Table.TableJPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class TableJPanel
extends ActiveJPanel
implements IPreserveState

This class has many of the capabilities of the JTable. The TableJPanel allows for random selection, with selection methods parallelling that of a typical spreadsheet program. This class does not extend JTable, thus only a few of the JTable methods are found in this class.

Note: Java's JTable uses multiple column indices for each column. Each column has a View index, where it visably "appears" in the table, and a Model index, how it was initially entered into the TableModel. Reordering of columns causes these two values to be different. This class expects all column values to be in Model indices, since the JTable methods work on this system.

Example: Column 0 and Column 2 are interchanged. The index 0 should still be used to reference Column 0, not Column 2.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

SELECTED_CHANGED

public static final java.lang.String SELECTED_CHANGED
"Selected Changed" - This messaging String is sent out whenever the mouse is released and a selection of cells has been completed. Calling getSelectedRegions() will return a list of TableRegions with the last region being the newly created region that generated this message.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SELECTION_CHANGING

public static final java.lang.String SELECTION_CHANGING
"Selection Changing" - This messaging String is sent out whenever the mouse is pressed and dragged, causing the selection of cells to be changed but not yet completed. Calling getSelectedRegions() will return a list of TableRegions that will not include the region that generated this message. Instead, call getActiveSelection() to get the changing selection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

help

public static javax.swing.JFrame help()
Contains control information about the TableJPanel. To view the information, use the WindowShower to visualize the help frame.

Returns:
JFrame containing help information for the table.

isSelected

public boolean isSelected(int row,
                          int column)
This method will return whether or not a cell is selected. If a selection of cells is actively occurring while this method is called, the cells within the active region will be judged as they appear, even though changing the active region will affect whether or not these cells are selected. It is safest to call this method after a selection is complete.

Parameters:
row - The cell row.
column - The cell column.
Returns:
True if selected or appear as selected if within an active selection.

getActiveSelection

public TableRegion getActiveSelection()
Get the actively changing selection. This method will only return a value if the selection is actively changing, otherwise null is returned. The SELECTION_CHANGING messaging String will be sent out when valid values exist.

Returns:
Snapshot of the changing selection as a TableRegion.

setLabelBackground

public void setLabelBackground(java.awt.Color color)
Set the background color for the cells where the row and column labels appear. The default is light gray.

Parameters:
color - The background color of the cells containing labels.

setColumnAlignment

public void setColumnAlignment(int alignment)
Set where the text is displayed in the table. Use Java's SwingContants class to specify column alignment. Alignment is limited to horizontal positioning, so valid alignments are LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT, EAST, and WEST.

setNumberFormat

public void setNumberFormat(int predecimal_digits,
                            int postdecimal_digits)
Set the format of how numbers are displayed in the table. If either predecimal_digits or postdecimal_digits is negative, formatting of that portion of the number is left unchanged. Formatting does not alter data, it only alters the appearance of the data.

Parameters:
predecimal_digits - The number of digits to appear "before" the decimal. This is primarily used for nicely displaying data in LEFT alignment. Numbers will not be visually clipped if they exceed the specified number of predecimal digits. However, spaces will be prepended to the number if the number of digits is below the specified number of predecimal digits. Predecimal digits include the ones, tens, hundreds, ... place.
postdecimal_digits - The number of digits to appear "after" the decimal. This includes the tenths,hundredths, thousandths, ... place.

displayRowLabels

public void displayRowLabels(boolean display)
Choose whether or not to display the row labels found to the left of the rows.

Parameters:
display - If true, display the row labels, else hide them.

displayColumnLabels

public void displayColumnLabels(boolean display)
Choose whether or not to display the column labels found above the columns.

Parameters:
display - If true, display the column labels, else hide them.

setRowLabels

public void setRowLabels(java.lang.Object[] labels)
Use this method to change the all of the labels used to identify rows. The new list of labels must exactly match the number of rows existing in the table.

Parameters:
labels - An array of labels, with size exactly matching the number of rows in the table.

public void setVisibleLocation(java.awt.Point col_row_pt)

Parameters:
col_row_pt - The column/row point specifying which cell will appear in the upper left-hand corner of the viewport.

                       int row,

convertPixelToColumnRow

public java.awt.Point convertPixelToColumnRow(java.awt.Point pixel_pt)
Convert a pixel point to a corresponding cell. The cell is specified by a Point pt, with pt.x = row # and pt.y = column # of the cell.

Parameters:
pixel_pt - The pixel point to be converted.
Returns:
A Point with cell row stored in x and cell column stored in y.

selectAll

public void selectAll()
Set all of the cells in this table to selected.

unselectAll

public void unselectAll()
This method will clear all selections, both in the vector and on the grid. This will not clear the table entries.

moveColumn

public void moveColumn(int column_to_move,
                       int target_column_index)
Move a column from its current index to a new index. Column mobility can also be achieved interactively by doing drag & drop on the column labels. Any column moves will void all existing selections, so column moves should be made before any selections occur.

Parameters:
column_to_move -
target_column_index -

enableMoveColumn

public void enableMoveColumn(boolean is_mobile)
Enable (true) or disable (false) the ability to move columns. This option is enabled by default.

Parameters:
is_mobile - If true, column mobility is enabled.

getEnableMoveColumn

public boolean getEnableMoveColumn()
Returns whether column reordering via drag & drop is enabled (true) or disabled (false). This option is enabled by default.

Returns:
If true, column reordering is enabled.

getSelectedCells

public PointRegion getSelectedCells()
Use this method to get all the selected cells without preserving the "shape" of selections. The list of (column,row) points is wrapped in a single PointRegion instance.

Returns:
A single PointRegion containing a list of selected cells.

getSelectedRegions

public TableRegion[] getSelectedRegions()
Get the selected cells in the form of a set of TableRegions. Use this method to preserve the "shape" of how cells were selected.

Returns:
The set of TableRegions that defines the selected cells.

setSelectedRegions

public void setSelectedRegions(TableRegion[] regions)
Set the selected cells in the form of a set of TableRegions. This call can be used to set a complicated pattern of selected cells. Calling this method will clear all previously selected cells. Passing in null will clear all selections. Use convertToTableRegions() method to convert any list of Regions to a list of TableRegions.

Parameters:
regions - The regions, each of which defines a rectangular region of cells that are either all selected or all unselected. Since regions may overlap, order is important.
See Also:
convertToTableRegions( Region[] any_region )

addSelectedRegion

public void addSelectedRegion(TableRegion region)
This method will add a selected or unselected rectangular region to the table. Since regions may overlap, the order in which regions are added is important. Previous selections will be retained using this method.

Parameters:
region - A rectangular region of cells that are either all selected or all unselected.

convertToTableRegions

public static TableRegion[] convertToTableRegions(Region[] any_region)
This method will take a list of any type of region and convert it to a list of TableRegions. Order is preserved, so selected and deselected TableRegions can be included in the list of Regions.

Parameters:
any_region - the list of Regions to be converted to TableRegions.
Returns:
A list of TableRegions that make up the same region as the list of regions passed in.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Test Program - use for testing only.

Parameters:
args - Command line arguments, these are ignored.
